dspdisa.help: Disassemble DSP code into text file
usage:
Syntax: dspdisa <dsp_ucode.bin> [start_addr]
disassemble dsp ucode from binary file and dump it into dspdisa.txt
start_addr in DSP slots;
Example of use: dspdisa Data\dsp_irom.bin 0x8000

dregs.output: Array [] of all DSP registers contents

usage: Register names: ar0 ar1 ar2 ar3 ix0 ix1 ix2 ix3
r8 r9 r10 r11 st0 st1 st2 st3
ac0h ac1h config sr prodl prodm1 prodh prodm2
ax0l ax0h ax1l ax1h ac0l ac1l ac0m ac1m

Syntax: dmem <dsp_addr>, dmem .
Dump 32 bytes of DMEM at dsp_addr. dsp_addr in halfword DSP slots.
dmem . will dump 0x800 bytes at dmem address 0
Example of use: dmem 0x8000

Syntax: imem <dsp_addr>, imem .
Dump 32 bytes of IMEM at dsp_addr. dsp_addr in halfword DSP slots.
imem . will dump 32 bytes of imem at program counter address.
Example of use: imem 0

drun.help: Run DSP thread until break, halt or dstop

usage:
Syntax: dbrk <dsp_addr>
Add breakpoint at dsp_addr. dsp_addr in halfword DSP slots.
Example of use: dbrk 0x8020

Syntax: dcan <dsp_addr> <message>
Add canary at dsp_addr. dsp_addr in halfword DSP slots.
When the PC is equal to the canary address, a debug message is displayed
Example of use: dcan 0x10 "Ucode entrypoint"

Syntax: dpc <dsp_addr>
Set DSP program counter to dsp_addr. dsp_addr in halfword DSP slots.
Example of use: dpc 0x8000

du.help: Disassemble some DSP instructions at pc / address

usage:
Syntax: cpumbox <value>
Example of use: cpumbox 0x8001FEED
Numbers must be in 2's complement 16-bit format
Numbers must be in unsigned 16-bit format

DspTranslateDMem.output: UInt64 (pointer). nullptr if cannot be translated.

DspTranslateIMem.output: UInt64 (pointer). nullptr if cannot be translated.

DspDisasm.output: Array: [Bool flowControl, Int instrSizeWords, String]. Empty string ("") mean disasm error
